alert.note: Alert for Coastal Ocean; Eastern Monmouth; Ocean; Western Monmouth (New Jersey) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly (New Jersey, Delaware, Southeastern Pennsylvania)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued September 11 at 6:47PM EDT by NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of northern Ocean and Monmouth Counties through 745 PM EDT... At 647 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from Highlands to near Marlboro to Cream Ridge. Movement was southeast at 20 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Long Branch, Asbury Park, Lakewood, Jackson, Howell, Marlboro, Manalapan, Tinton Falls, Holmdel, Red Bank, Manasquan, Highlands, Point Pleasant Beach, Farmingdale, Mantoloking, Allenwood, East Freehold, Six Flags Theme Park, West Freehold and Cassville. This includes the following highways... Interstate 195 in New Jersey between mile markers 13 and 34. Garden State Parkway between mile markers 91 and 113. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.

area.areaDesc: Coastal Ocean; Eastern Monmouth; Ocean; Western Monmouth
